headline: Mmm-Mmm Better Brownies
description: A brownie recipe with oil, cocoa powder, flour, and eggs that's easy to make. Chopped walnuts add a nice crunch factor to this very chocolaty treat!

video.description: See how to make a brownie even better!
video.name: Mmm-Mmm Better Brownies

name: Mmm-Mmm Better Brownies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch square baking pan.
Mix sugar, oil, and vanilla together in a medium bowl; beat in eggs until well combined.
Mix flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl; gradually stir into egg mixture until well blended. Stir in walnuts. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until the brownie begins to pull away from the edges of the pan, about 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack before cutting into 16 squares.

review.reviewBody: I was surprised, w/the high-star rating, that I did not care for these at all. :( I made them exactly per the recipe. They did not seem like a good, homemade brownie. They reminded me of a brownie you may buy premade at the grocery store that has a 'chemical' taste, if that makes sense. I will not make this recipe again. Thank you for the recipe.
Lackluster
Needed a dairy free recipe due to allergies and these were great. Texture was perfect.

These are delicious and my new go to. I didn't have walnuts, so I used pecans. I also threw a handful of milk chocolate chips on top before baking. I did bake a little too long, and I used a smaller baking dish (glass). I'll be ordering a metal square pan for next time. Thank you for posting!
I like fudgy brownies and these hit the mark! Perfect chocolate taste and they are indeed Mmm! Miss Mmm
So easy. Can sub 4 oz unsweetened chocolate for cocoa
Fudgy and moist! Easy to prep and not too many ingredients. 25 min was not enough though. I needed 35 min in the oven.
My girls love it!!.. so easy to make... Thank you for the recipe...üòäüòä

Perfect, don"t change any ingredients! I used a spoon till smooth. I did stir in the coco before the flour though it's easier that way They come out with that nice little crunch on the top. Simple and excellent.
Turned out really good, only took 20 minutes to bake, smell and taste so goodüòã

This is my first time making brownies. I added chocolate cream cheese frosting. I'm not a big brownie fan, but this is some kind of delicious. Moist, chocolaty, and gone in less than two hours, from a family of four. I did get two pieces. I will not look for another brownie recipe. This is my go to, from now on. Highly recommended.
The brownies are excellent. Easy and all ways come out great. I‚Äôll keep this as my go to brownie recipe.
Simple to make and delicious. i used an 8 X 8. mine were done in 25 minutes.

I was out of butter and vanilla, so I searched for brownies using oil and no butter. I like to make recipes exactly as is the first time, but in this case I had no choice but to omit the vanilla, counting on the chocolate to hide the lack. This recipe couldn't be simpler, and the brownies were very good. While replacing the butter with oil didn't transform this into a health food, it is still an improvement, and every little bit helps. Won't be going back to using butter.

This is the only brownie recipe you need! It bakes up beautifully with a crackly top and chewy edges. I‚Äôve been making this recipe for 7 years and it‚Äôs perfect every time. Double the ingredients to make a 13x9 pan.
It's a good simple recipe. They're fudgie üëç‚ù§ I didn't have any vanilla , so I used almond flavor... Love em ' !
Literally THE best brownies, and just as quick and easy as using a boxed mix. We use melted butter in place of oil, add a ton of chocolate chips and bake in an 8x8. They are fudgy and delicious!
Better than a box mix. And just as fast.
This is the best brownie recipe out there, without a doubt!
Awesome. We added about a half cup of bittersweet chocolate chips and about the same of chopped walnuts. Reduced sugar to 3/4 cup. These were really good. No picture because we ate them too fast.
Made these last night. They are really good. Tastes as good as any other brownie I've had. Kinda cake like but still slightly rich. That's perfect for me.
My son n pops loved it. Thank u
This recipe for brownies is so easy to make and there so good ty for the amazing recipe
Rlly good brownies! They took about 30 mins to be cooked tho
I just made these and for my first time making brownies, they came out soft and sweet. I used cane sugar instead of white sugar and only had to use 1/2 cup. Also almonds add a nice chew!
Loved the recipe
These had a nice texture, but I found them way too sweet. Not sure what might happen if you cut the sugar, but I think it's overkill.

I've made this twice without changing anything. They weren't good the first time I made it, so tried once more after reading all the positive reviews. Had the same blah results the second time. I guess we all have an ideal brownie in mind and this one isn't for me. It's not at all chewy and moist which is what I gathered from the reviews. It's more dry and flat. I'll keep looking for the basic brownie recipe to curb that chocolate craving.

It is the best brownie . 
I and my family really enjoyed it .Instead of walnuts , I used some matched peanuts and it was delicious
They turned out too wet for my liking. The ratio of dry ingredients to wet ingredients is not right. 60gm of flour + 40 gm of cocoa powder to 125ml of oil and 2 eggs in my op is a bit off.

These were probably the best brownies I've ever eaten in my life. The main trick I used was substituting vegetable oil for peanut oil. I also halved the sugar and used extra pink salt instead of regular salt. 20 minutes was the perfect for me since I also like my brownies slightly underbaked. Absolute perfection. Would definitely recommend the oil substitution to others
Spongey and weird. Unpleasant. I'll still eat it because it's a waste otherwise.
Yummy lol be it. Never make a box mix again. So easy.
the brownies were yummy
i really liked it, it was moist tasted better then box its a heavier brownie then box. But to much sugar to make often with someone in the house that watches there sugar.

I was so excited to try this recipe, when I did It left me very disappointed. There is nothing different with this recipe with the taste and the need to double the recipe so it‚Äôs not to thin. I used the recommended baking pan.

Super easy straight forward brownie. So delicious. Definitely a go to recipe for me when i need a quick brownie fix. I don't care for walnuts in my brownies but I have added things like cherries or chocolate chips to them.

My son and I wanted a sweet treat that wouldn't take too long. We started with the brownie idea then had fun making it special. We added 2 Tablespoons Bourbon, 3/4 cup of pecans instead of walnuts and then 3/4 cup fresh raspberries. It needed to cook about 8 minutes longer because it was so moist but totally worth it!! Next time we plan to add semi-sweet chocolate chips as well!
I used butter instead of oil for this one. Turn out pretty good.

This is my go to for making brownies. It's so easy to add and subtract the extra's! We don't like to add nuts, but I do add a bit of fresh mint from outside or half vanilla extract half coffee extract. The only real problem is how fast they disappear!

When I first went to work in Baltimore where I lived I used to make brownies every day and I didn't have any chocolate so I used cocoa powder instead. It works! It's delicious. Now I'm a diabetic and I put a new sugar substitute in it and it works!
They are a hit with my family!

Yes i did it!
I tried half of the recipe, used mixed coconut flour and wholewheat flour
And it turned out successfully, fudgy and cracky topped.
I love it
Thank u for this recipe
Awesome
My friends call these my 'crack' brownies. I add butterscotch chips and dollups of nutella for the extra addiction properties.
A very tasty brownie! Good go-to for quick scratch recipe. Sometimes I like to put pecans on top instead of walnuts within . I like the toasty pecan flavor with the chewy chocolate.
I love it

I did this in a mini brownie pan, using paper cups (no clean up!) and had extra, so I did the leftovers in a muffin pan. SO good!! I have a dark pan, so I turned it down to 325f and baked for 25 mins. Perfect! I'll use this going forward.

I LOVE this recipe! Best brownie recipe I‚Äôve ever tried! I actually added about 1/3 cup of chocolate chips; the little ones, and it makes it like there‚Äôs chocolate melting in your mouth as you taste a bit too must and perfectly sweet. I TOTALLY recommend if you are a chocolate lover

Dairy free, quick, easy and yummy. Every time I'm about to run out and get an either pricy or junky treat I'm reminded of this great recipe. It is the classic brownie recipe, I wonder if you can make it with less sugar for a slightly more bitter taste.
I'll definitely make it again!
Not bad. I added chocolate chips to it to make it a bit more chocolatey!
I added about teaspoon of instant coffee and cooked it for 29 minutes. Really good but not as good as the one with butter.
This has been my go-to brownie recipe for at LEAST 6 years. It is SO. GOOD!!!
This has been my go-to brownie recipe for at LEAST 6 years. It is SO. GOOD!!!
These are the best brownies, easy to make and not a lot of ingredients. love them.

I added 2 tablespoons of water because it was pretty thick, and I put it in the cupcake pan. I used milk chocolate chips instead of walnuts and set the timer for 17 minutes. After that, I just watched until it looked baked through.

These are terrific! This recipe is a keeper. I was looking for a recipe with healthier ingredients, and also had some amazing Rapunzel organic cocoa powder on hand and walnuts to use up, along with fresh eggs from a farmer's market. We prefer our brownies cake-like, and these work perfectly for us. To the reader(s) who complain about the fishy- oily taste, you need to make sure that your canola oil is new and smells fresh. Our brownies made tonight were perfectly fine with new oil. That gives it a moist texture. These will keep longer than those brownies made with butter, and also have less saturated fat and cholesterol. Definitely add walnuts if you have some on hand and are able to eat nuts. I put mine in a plastic bag ahead of time, and rolled out with a rolling pin to have ready to fold into the finished batter.

 We made a few tweaks in this recipe: 1) I greased the 10 x 6 1/2 inch pyrex pan with butter and dusted with flour. That makes it perfectly easy to get out after cooling (so no need for parchment paper). 2) We upped the cocoa amount to 1/2 cup. I used a wire whisk to mix the dry ingredients ahead of time in a separate bowl. 3) After creaming the sugar and oil with a wire whisk, I then added the vanilla and mixed that in and after that, whisked in the egg. 4) Just whisk the eggs into the oil/sugar/vanilla mixture for 40 strokes or so with a wire whisk (per instructions I'd read online from a Ghiradelli mix). The word "Beat" in this recipe here implies usi
These are the best homemade brownies. Better than the 2 bite store bought. Remember not to over stir them.

These brownies were awesome, they were quick and easy to make with excellent results. They were perfect; just the right amount of cooca and nuts. I loved them they were fudgy, chewy and delicious. Thanks so much for sharing. A new family favorite. I served them plain with Maple Crunch Ice Cream for a truly decadent treat. BK
Yummy!!

I made this recipe and it was really good and it tastes good with vegetable oil. The only concern is when I used vegtable oil, there was so many air bubbles and I had to pop them. Then I put in the oven and 10 minutes later, the texture was rocky and not what I wanted, but I would say it is ok. I prefer using butter then vegetable oil to avoid air bubbles.
Loved this recipe. easy to work with
This is the best brownie recipe I've tried(doubled the ingredients)

This is an amazing recipe! It yielded the best brownies, which make me want to never ever go out and another store-bought or bakery brownie again. I did reduce the sugar to 3/4 cup instead of 1. but kept everything else the same.
Easy recipe but didn't care for them. Sort of bland and not very brownie like compared to other ones I have tried. Sorry, maybe I didn't do something right but all ingredients were added as stated.
Love them!
Did not change a thing. My whole family loved them. They seem lean at the same time quite tasty, great for coffee.
Best brownies ever!! Followed the recipe to a T (maybe added a little extra chocolate) but WOW just falls apart so good
This is THE best brownie recipe I have ever tried, no lie. Simple ingredients, easy to put together and the brownies turn out thick, moist and delicious!!! Definitely my new go-to.
This cake is perfect for a tiered birthday cake. It‚Äôs a dense, delicious cake that holds up well when stacked. I added almond extract to give it a little extra flavor.
I loved it..It's good recipe.I just add 2 tablespoon of butter coz in the end it's little sticky.But all goes well.Thanks!
I prefer a ‚Äúfudge‚Äù style brownie as opposed to a ‚Äúcake‚Äù consistency. Made this with butter instead of veg oil; otherwise followed the recipe without changes. Easy/quick/delicious! BHL
So easy! I changed the oil to melted butter and added about a half tablespoon of coffee to enhance the chocolate, so easy and so yummy!!

These were honestly the best tasting brownies I‚Äôve ever had and I‚Äôve tried many recipes. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars is because I agree with other reviewers that something was a little off with either the pan size or the baking time. I baked them in the recommended 9x9 pan size for the recommended 20 to 25 minutes. They were very thin and they were not done. Had to cook for at least an additional 10-15 minutes. I know all ovens are different, but that‚Äôs a very big difference. I would make these again, but would definitely double or even triple the recipe, as I‚Äôve seen in a few other reviews, and bake for longer time.
they are easy to make .they are still baking will let you know how they come out when they are done .so far i love this recipe so easy .

I used all butter because it was 1 a.m. and I had no oil. Perfection for me. Not too sweet and nice and rich. I did double the recipe and made it in a 15x17" pan. I should have drop the cooking time down to 15 minutes. I baked them for 20 and they came out less gooey then I like but still stellar.
I doesn't get any easier than this. This recipe makes an excellent fudgy brownie.

They were very good! I only make boxed brownies. My 12 year old daughter wanted to make brownies. She found this recipe and we had all the ingredients minus the walnuts. There wasn't much volume to this recipe. But they doubled in size when baking. She made a second batch and used a smaller pan but it still didn't fill the square 5X5. I would double next time we make these. Flavor was on point, perfect chocolate amount. Not too sweet- Just right
Best brownies ever! This is the only brownie recipe I ever make!
Use butter like the suggestions state.

We doubled the recipe (9x13), omitted the nuts (school friendly) and added a can of eagle brand caramel in the Center. Baked for 30 min. So delicious. Fluffy and moist. No icing needed. Definitely a keeper. Thanks for sharing.
Sometimes I like to put white chocolate chips in them instead of walnuts. It is nice and easy to make and tastes delicious!
Perfectly chewy yummy and rich. I used a high quality cocoa powder and butter to make mine and sheer perfection.
This is the ONLY recipe I use for brownies. I usually double it and use a 9√ó13 non-stick pan. My daughter loves them and so do her co-workers!
I did as suggested and used melted butter instead of oil. And used an 8x8 pan. The best brownies I‚Äôve ever made!
Best brownies ever. My family can't get enough of it. Made 5 batches in the past 24 hours and my family wants more. They are gone before they have a chance to cook
Only change i made was substituting the white sugar for agave 1/2 cup. And i made cupcakes and the rest i put in another pan. Turned out great, kids loved it!

I picked this recipe because I didn‚Äôt have any butter on hand and all the stores were closed. I‚Äôm glad I did! I put the batter in cupcake tins. I didn‚Äôt have walnuts but they still tasted really nice. The top had a touch of crunch and the inside was nice and chocolatey. I topped them with vanilla royal icing and crushed candy cane.
The fudgiest most delicious brownies I ever made
These were great and so easy to make. The only thing I did differently was add 1/2 bag of chocolate chips. I will use this recipe from now on.
I have been baking these for a long time, now my daughter (10) bake them for us. Such a delicious treat. We do reduce the sugar amount to 3/4, still really good.
The best homemade brownie recipe that I've come across. So rich, buttery, and so delicious! I will continue to use this brownie recipe.
So easy and delicious. I used a cup of walnuts and wheat flour. They turned out so good, I ate two and so did my husband!
Easy recipe and directions. Great homemade brownies, my kids love them

I have tried a lot of brownie recipes over the years, and I think this is the best one. They are rich and chocolaty, and I like that I can make them with olive oil, which is the only cooking oil I have used for over 10 years. The brownies go fast, and everyone says they are yummy.

It was flavorful, it was not pretty! 
Is there an adjustment to this recipe if at 7,000 feet? This was such a disappointment. It rose in the pan at 25 min it all collapsed!
Instead of vanilla I used almond extract.
Best recipe, do easy to memorize. Easily modifiable; I like to add tbsp of ground coffee and a 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts. Amazing!
